title: Godot Engine Official
description: Godot is a 2D and 3D free and open source game engine developed by a community of contributors. It provides a huge set of common tools, so you can just focus on making your game without reinventing the wheel.

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.3 dev 1
items.description: We're ending the year with an early sneak peak at the upcoming Godot 4.3 release with its first dev snapshot!
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

items.title: Prepare to hear a lot more from us!
items.description: The Godot Foundation is onboarding a person in charge of Community & Communications, and there is a feedback form for you to fill out.
items.dc:creator: Godot Foundation

items.title: Announcing a collaboration with Google and The Forge
items.description: We are excited to announce that we have partnered with Google and The Forge to bring some helpful performance optimizations to our Vulkan mobile backend.
items.dc:creator: Clay John

items.title: Maintenance release: Godot 4.2.1
items.description: This first maintenance release fixes a number of platform compatibility issues introduced in Godot 4.2, which should make it much easier to upgrade from 4.1 or start new projects on all platforms.
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: Introducing the new Godot Forum
items.description: We are finally unveiling the new Godot forum which replaces our Q&A platform while unlocking many new features.
items.dc:creator: Winston Yallow

items.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.2.1 RC 1
items.description: Godot 4.2 was released one week ago, and as is customary with feature updates, we have a late harvest of regression fixes to offer!
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: Godot Foundation Update 2023
items.description: This year has marked significant milestones for the Godot Foundation, and it's all thanks to the incredible support from our community.
items.dc:creator: Godot Foundation

items.title: Godot 4.2 arrives in style!
items.description: Godot 4.2 brings more rendering features and better platform support, it's also faster, easier to use, and more reliable!
items.dc:creator: Godot contributors

items.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.2 RC 2
items.description: The first release candidate brought another crop of regression reports, which we've now fixed!
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: Submissions open for Godot 2023 showreel!
items.description: Showcase your Godot creations in 2023! We're inviting submissions of short videos featuring your published or in-progress Godot games or tools. Don't miss this chance to be a part of it!
items.dc:creator: Emi

items.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.2 RC 1
items.description: With every critical bug identified and squashed, we are making our last turn and preparing to sprint to the finish line with Godot 4.2!
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 beta 6
items.description: We're almost ready for a release candidate! This 6th beta fixes a number of regressions via some relatively core changes which will need thorough testing.
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 beta 5
items.description: More critical fixes are coming your way on the road to Godot 4.2 stable, including smoother transition for 3D projects made in 4.1.
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

items.title: Maintenance release: Godot 4.1.3
items.description: With stability in mind, Godot contributors offer yet another set of changes for Godot 4.1 users, addressing a variety of bugs related to rendering, input, GUI, and platform support.
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 beta 4
items.description: We continue iterating quickly on beta snapshots for Godot 4.2 to ensure that we can solve regressions before the stable release.
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.1.3 RC 1
items.description: Another batch of fixes and stability improvements for Godot 4.1 users is ready to be tested. Of note, this release addresses a number of rendering and GUI issues, and improves class documentation.
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 beta 3
items.description: We continue iterating quickly on beta snapshots for Godot 4.2 to ensure that we can solve regressions before the stable release.
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: State of particles and future updates
items.description: An update on the current state of the particle system in Godot, and some hints about what the future holds!
items.dc:creator: Ilaria Cislaghi

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 beta 2
items.description: After last week's 4.2 beta 1 release, we introduced fixes for a number of bugs reported by the community, which are now ready to test in beta 2.
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 beta 1
items.description: With all planned major and minor features implemented, Godot 4.2 is ready for beta testing!
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

items.title: Maintenance release: Godot 4.1.2
items.description: As Godot 4.2 enters feature freeze this week, a new Godot 4.1 maintenance release arrives with a handful of improvements to stability and performance!
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 dev 6
items.description: Final 4.2 dev snapshot before we enter the beta phase, and it's absolutely feature-packed!
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: Maintenance release: Godot 3.5.3
items.description: It's been way too long since our previous 3.5 maintenance release! This new Godot 3.5.3 fixes a number of important issues and adjusts to changing platform requirements.
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.1.2 RC 1
items.description: It's long overdue for the second Godot 4.1 patch release! This release candidate contains a number of important fixes, including performance and stability improvements, so let's give it a good test.
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov
